list: Contribute to Jenkins pipelines
Making effort to CI/CD processes to improve them
Develop middleware to help yourself in CI/CD area

qualifications: Strong knowledge of Jenkins pipelines and Jenkins shared library (Groovy)
Hands-on with build tools (Maven. Gradle, npm, yarn, PHP-composer, go build etc.)
Experience with Ansible and Terraform
Understanding of delivery process to Kubernetes
Extensive knowledge of CD tools
Coding skills on Golang and Python

list: Develop rich, interactive, enterprise web pages for desktop and mobile
Develop new user-facing features
Directing or performing company website updates
Developing or validating test routines and schedules to ensure that test cases address all browser and device types
Optimize web pages performance through A/B testing
Uphold quality layout according to corporate guidelines
Make recommendations to optimize and streamline web templates
Work collaboratively with other developers/designers
Maintaining and promoting a successful and positive work environment

qualifications: Proficiency in HTML5 and CSS3
Good experience with client-side scripting and JavaScript frameworks, including jQuery
Ability to write complex front-end scenarios
Understand principle of UI and UX in web
Confident use of SASS preprocessor and experience with Pug preprocessor
Layout building experience for web (cross-browser and adaptive layout) without CSS-frameworks, including animation and interactivity
Strong written and verbal communication skills in English
Dedicated team player
Accurate and detail-oriented  and responsible personality. Ability to meet deadlines and a goal-oriented mindset
Experience with BEM-methodology, Git (GitLab), Figma, npm and Gulp is an advantage
Experience in A/B testing is an advantage
It will be a plus if you have experience of coding HTML-emails. Knowledge of the various nuances of email clients (especially Outlook)

list: Assist in the completion of US state and local tax returns
Calculate estimated state payments
Calculate monthly use tax, file sales and use tax returns and make payments
Assist with examinations/audits of the Groupâ€™s subsidiariesâ€™ tax returns
Resolve state and local tax notices
Assist with the preparation of the ASC 740 tax provision calculation for the US Companies with a focus on state implications
Reconcile tax general ledger accounts
Prepare and review various other tax and compliance filings, as needed, including property tax
Identify opportunities for efficiencies in tax department processes
Research state tax issues and provide tax planning ideas, including, but not limited to state tax nexus, state implications of TCJA, sales/use tax issues, property tax
Keep up to date on tax law changes and their impact on the organization
Special projects, as needed

qualifications: asd
sss
Asdas

list: Implementation, management, and maintenance leveraging Google Tag Manager, Google Analytics, and other digital marketing platforms
Creating and maintaining detailed documentation of analytics events, variables, segments, etc
Identifying gaps in the data capture strategy and collaboratively implementing enhancements
Working across teams to design custom segments based on historical qualitative and quantitative data that can be used to enhance our reporting
Collaborating with team members preparing data sets
Collaborating with technical analytics analyst, web production, web development and marketing teams to implement required tracking and tagging

qualifications: Developing intuitive, scalable dashboards, reports, and analyses to track website performance and aid in planning and decision-making
Analyzing complex data sets and transform raw data into actionable insights that ensure marketing efforts are effectively driving awareness, conversion, growth, and revenue
Creating data visualizations and presentations to provide actionable and compelling insights to stakeholders that are easy to understand and have demonstrable results
Applying comprehensive views of online consumer behaviors through quantitative (online), and qualitative (voice of customer, usability, etc.) metrics to support stakeholders

list: Lead the establishment of core standard reports, data sets and metrics to be used by the business globally and become the â€˜expertâ€™ in global data for the defined process
Provide vision of what is needed for the business and lead the team in creation of dashboards to support the business for decision making
Perform high-level ad-hoc analyses, quantitative and qualitative, to guide business improvement hypotheses and drive decisions
Supply materials required for QBRs, Summits, and All Hands meetings in a timely manner
Maintain projects related to standardization of existing Reporting and existing knowledge base
Work with other business areas including Data Quality and Data Warehouse to reconcile data differences and add data sources as needed
Develop processes and procedures to ensure business solutions meet strategic goals
Collaborate with team members to collect, analyze, and evaluate information from multiple sources

qualifications: Team lead or manager in a previous role
Advanced Excel
PowerPoint
Experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, Clik, or equivalent)
Data wrangling / etl
Data analysis
Strong problem-solving and management skills
Excellent communication and analytical skills
Technical writing
Experience in project management

list: Managing configurations, troubleshooting, provisioning and coordinating 3rd party systems integration
Designing network architecture to accommodate growth and changes in the company environment
Implementing changes and configuring equipment
Dealing with tickets, clarify user concerns and gather all necessary information to troubleshoot and resolve issues and service in a timely manner
Maintaining configuration backups, network diagrams, and any other documentation as required
Dealing with vendors and service providers
Analyzing system performance to ensure high system availability and accessibility for all respective users
Proactively monitoring the network using software tools to identify problems before outages or performance degradation occur

qualifications: CCNP R&S/CCNP Security certification or equivalent knowledge/experience level
Substantial operational experience with Cisco enterprise-class routers, firewalls (ASA/vASA, NGWF, FirePower), switches and wireless solutions
Enterprise network design experience
Routine operations automation (Python, Gitlab, Ansible)

list: Develops sales activities with commercial segment new customers; upsells and cross sells to the existing commercial customers
Develops sales pipeline by proactive calling to convert sales conversations to identified prospects
Works cross functionally and cooperatively to consistently drive opportunities forward towards closure â€“ this includes Sales Engineering, Inside Sales and Channel
Closes business in conjunction with Veeam partners (in tier-two model)
Meets individual and team revenue targets
Leverages business generated by partners with end users/customers
Drives account strategies and coordinates team selling efforts with Inside Sales Reps, Channel Partner Managers, Marketing, Sales Engineering and others to close business
Ownership of the planning and execution of territory plan(s) for territory growth â€“ growing existing business and winning net new logos
Enters forecasting and account/opportunity details in Veeamâ€™s CRM (SalesForce)
Engages with Veeam Strategic Alliance Partners to drive mutually beneficial revenue opportunities
Proposes, coordinates and participates to marketing activities within the territory
Ability to travel 0 - 75% of the time within the assigned territory/region

qualifications: Strong verbal and written communications skills including presentation skills
An aptitude for understanding and articulating how technology products and solutions can drive desired outcomes and solve common business problems.
Bachelor's Degree and/or equivalent years of experience
At least three (3) years of sales, selling software through the channels and end users
Experience in business-to-business selling and managing using a consultative sales approach, and will have strong demonstrated closing skills
Ability to work independently and collaboratively with limited direction in a fast-paced environment
Knowledge of large distributors and value-added resellers (VARâ€™s) is highly desired
Knowledge of virtualization industry, backup and recovery and competitive landscape highly desired
Experience with target account selling, solution selling, value-based selling and/or consultative sales techniques
Knowledge of different sales methodologies and customer relationship management (CRM) system; SalesForce knowledge is required
Microsoft Office tools (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.), Sales Tools (ZoomInfoLinkedIN, TechTarget)

list: Leads a team of approximately 5 Federal Inside Sales Representatives, driving overachievement and goals with coaching, performance management, engagement, and career development
Nurtures a positive team environment, in alignment with Veeam's Core Values. Educates team on Federal sales practices
Manages team performance against quotas and sales forecasts, executes operating plans and ensures sales objectives are met
Drives revenue and contributes to the continued growth of Veeam through consistently achieving individual and team quotas
Monitors daily activity of sales representatives; including sales activities and use of Veeam's CRM (Salesforce.com)
Drives metrics to measure performance of the inside sales activities; corrects deficiencies where necessary
Collaborates with field sales employees on territory division of labor and sales execution.

qualifications: 2+ years of Federal inside sales management or supervisory experience preferred; telephone and internet based sales experience required
Bachelorâ€™s Degree preferred (a combination of education and experience will be considered)
Demonstrated experience in building, training, managing, developing and getting results from an inside sales team
Skilled motivator with demonstrated ability to coach and develop sales staff to exceed targeted sales objectives and deliver high quality service to customers
Proven track record of driving high volume, transactional sales along with more complex enterprise sales
Ability to work well with all levels of people and teams in a matrix-organization structure. Solid understanding of Federal procurement process
Excellent management and communication skills (written and verbal)
Demonstrated knowledge of Federal procurement process
Customer relationship management (CRM) systems; SalesForce.com is preferred
Knowledge of virtualization technology; VMware and/or Microsoft is highly desirable
Knowledge of storage vendors and partners

list: Managing internal and external relationships in a highly leverage, matrixed environment
Develop goals that are measurable and drive productivity within SHI and its operating units
Participating in impactful QBRs with meaningful and measurable action items, as well as follow-up
Leverage executive level relationships within SHI and its operating units
Achieving revenue targets and goals for SHI and its operating units
Developing and executing partner plan with variable rebates and goals
Recruiting, training and enabling SHI and its subsidiary sellers with the focus on East Coast Business
Working closely with VMware, Microsoft, HP and other eco-system product managers

qualifications: uccessful sales experience with channel-focused company and 2 tier distributors in North America
Proven results driving business objectives across the SHI eco-system
Proven track record of successful product management within a 2 tier model
Knowledge of virtualization technology and leverage within a 2 tier model
Ability to adapt to changes in roles and responsibilities
Ability to work independently with limited direction in a fast-paced environment; must be a high-energy, motivated self-starter
Analytical thinker with proven ability to metric and govern

list: Assist Veeam and Global System Integrators (GSIs) in enterprise opportunities driven by GSIs across all GEOs when needed. Be prepared to assist the field in any way possible but also maintain and enforce appropriate escalation procedures. Appropriately manage the volume, size, and strategic value of deals youâ€™re engaged with
Support in the creation of high-level strategy for top GSI partners by understanding overall market trends and the partner portfolio of products and solutions as a key member of the GSI business team
Develop and lead training and enablement strategy and plan with each GSI to establish and grow Veeam expertise within the technical and delivery communities
Support GSI POCs, NFR, and validation efforts as required to drive new solutions, offerings, and close business
Participate in quarterly reviews (QBRs) between the Veeam sponsor, GSI partner executives, and Veeam global virtual teams and drive the solution and technical enablement aspects of the reviews

qualifications: Expert-level experience in GSI specific technical offering and solutions building including working in a team accountable for achieving revenue goals
Deep understanding of GSI culture and how to achieve results through personal network building and collaboration within a fluent partner ecosystem environment
Deep architecture knowledge of VMware virtualization and related infrastructure and storage technologies
Deep architecture knowledge of at least one of the public hyperscale cloud providers (e.g. AWS, Azure, Google)
Hands on knowledge of data protection & disaster recovery technologies a bonus but not requirement
Advanced skills in Enterprise Datacenter Infrastructure designs and technologies (storage, virtualization, networking)
Previous pre-sales or other experience interacting with a global partner or large strategic customer
